intro: Lerchenfeldia vestita, commonly known as the naked lerchenfeldia, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant features simple, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically small and clustered in whorls, displaying a range of colors from white to pink. Lerchenfeldia vestita is adapted to grow in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or mountainous regions.
